metadata.title: CVE-2023-52723 on Ubuntu 24.04 LTS (noble) - medium
metadata.description:
In KDE libksieve before 23.03.80, kmanagesieve/session.cpp places acleartext password in server logs because a username variable isaccidentally given a password value.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-52723` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

kio-sieve - 4:23.08.5-0ubuntu3
libkpim5kmanagesieve5 - 4:23.08.5-0ubuntu3
libkpim5ksieve-data - 4:23.08.5-0ubuntu3
libkpim5ksieve5 - 4:23.08.5-0ubuntu3
libkpim5ksieveui5 - 4:23.08.5-0ubuntu3
No subscription required

criterions.comment: libkf5ksieve package in noble, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4:23.08.5-0ubuntu3').
